intro: Spilotantha nigricans, commonly known as the black-stemmed spilotantha, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves, which are adapted to store water in arid environments. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors including yellow, orange, and red. Spilotantha nigricans is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
